summary: An email chain from June 26, 2020, where an individual using the alias "R O" is attempting to extort Mark L. Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, for $25,000. The sender threatens to release a letter allegedly written by Jeffrey Epstein to Mark, along with other documents concerning communications with two models, to media outlets like the New York Post if payment is not made.

persons.name: Mark L. Epstein
persons.context: Recipient of threatening emails demanding $25,000; sender claims to possess a letter from his brother Jeffrey and other compromising documents.

persons.name: R O
persons.context: Sender of threatening emails from the address 'eskadrad1@gmail.com', demanding money from Mark L. Epstein and threatening to release documents to the media.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as Mark's brother; the extortionist claims to possess a letter he wrote to Mark.

connections.description: Mark is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's brother in the context of the extortion threat.
Extortionist demanding $25,000 from Mark L. Epstein under threat of releasing sensitive documents.

events.title: Extortion Threat Emails
events.description: A series of threatening emails are sent to Mark L. Epstein demanding $25,000, with threats to release a letter from Jeffrey Epstein and documents about communications with two models to the media.

keyFacts: An individual using the alias 'R O' attempted to extort $25,000 from Mark L. Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, in June 2020.
The extortionist claimed to possess a letter written by Jeffrey Epstein to his brother Mark.
The threat involved releasing the letter and documents concerning communications with two female models to media outlets, specifically naming the New York Post.
The extortionist referenced obtaining information from Mark L. Epstein's computer.
The correspondence demonstrates attempts to exploit the Epstein case for financial gain after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
